item.title: In Mississippi’s Capital City, Indicted District Attorney Flouts Campaign Disclosure Laws
item.description: While he fights federal bribery charges, Jody Owens faces sanctions for not disclosing campaign funds and spending. Weak laws confuse enforcement.

item.title: Why We Still Don’t Have Enough Solid Data on Pregnancy in Prison
item.description: A new report sheds light on pregnant people behind bars, but misses their lived experience.

item.title: When New Jersey Switches Prison Tablet Companies, I’ll Lose 10 Years of Family Memories
item.description: Writer Shakeil Price uses his JPay tablet as a hard drive for his photos and videos. He’ll soon have to mail it home or have it destroyed.

item.title: The Marshall Project Announces $1M Challenge Grant From Board Chair Liz Simons to Support Criminal Justice Journalism
item.description: The need for trusted, fact-based reporting has never been more urgent.

item.title: The Marshall Project Is a Finalist for the Pulitzer Prize for Feature Writing
item.description: Joe Sexton’s sweeping narrative ‘The Hardest Case for Mercy’ explored the efforts to spare the life of the Parkland school shooter.
